snippet: The United States sees potential meetings with Iran as an opportunity to discuss the threat posed by the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, the Sunni extremist group.
abstract: Senior American and Iranian diplomats meet to explore whether United States and Iran can work together to create more stable Iraqi government and ease threat from Sunni militants; complicating picture are parallel talks between Iran and world powers on its nuclear program.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and DAVID E. SANGER
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Washington, and David E. Sanger from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: The United States sees potential meetings with Iran as an opportunity to discuss the threat posed by the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria, the Sunni extremist group.

headline.main: U.S. Is Exploring Talks With Iran on Crisis in Iraq
headline.print_headline: U.S. Is Exploring Talks With Iran on Crisis in Iraq

keywords.value: Islamic State of Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
